page.title: 17Brickmaking
page.content: Brickmaking as such has almost completely ceased in the area, but the sands, clays and gravels which made it so important to the economy of Sevenoaks are still very important. The major companies involved produce the raw materials and the finished products used in almost all forms of construction from garden patios to motorway bridges. The range of concretes possible is very large and heavy lorries are constantly passing through the estates around the quarries. The quarries are vast and have greatly altered the geography of the Greatness area, which was of great importance historically to the growth of Sevenoaks. The operations are now being used for the benefit of the area as the flooded disused quarries are used for watersports.
